title: Add Change Password to Admin Settings

requirements.text: In the Settings section of the admin dashboard (`frontend/src/pages/admin/AdminDashboardPage.tsx`), add a dedicated 'Change Password' subsection with fields for: current password (for verification), new password, and confirm new password. On submit, verify the current password against the active credentials stored in AuthContext, then if valid and new passwords match, update the password in AuthContext state and sessionStorage so it persists for the session. Display a clear success message on save or a descriptive error message on failure (wrong current password, password mismatch, or empty fields). The form must be styled consistently with the existing dark gradient admin theme.
acceptanceCriteria: A 'Change Password' form is visible in the admin dashboard Settings section.
The form has three fields: Current Password, New Password, and Confirm New Password.
Submitting with the wrong current password shows an error message.
Submitting with mismatched new password and confirm new password shows an error message.
Submitting with all empty fields shows a validation error.
On a valid submission, the password is updated in AuthContext state and sessionStorage.
A success message is displayed after a successful password change.
The admin can log out and log back in using the new password.
The form and messages are styled consistently with the existing dark gradient admin theme.

constraints: Do not modify any file under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, or frontend/src/components/ui.
Credential updates must be applied to AuthContext state and sessionStorage only â€” no backend persistence required for this feature.
The change password feature must be contained within the existing Settings section of AdminDashboardPage.tsx.
nonGoals: Adding a change username form (already covered by existing Settings section).
Storing admin credentials in the Motoko backend.
Adding a password reset/forgot password flow.
Sending any email or notification on password change.
